propDescriptions.checkedIcon: The icon to display when the component is checked.
propDescriptions.className: Class name applied to the root element.
propDescriptions.color: The color of the component. It supports those theme colors that make sense for this component.
propDescriptions.defaultChecked: The default checked state. Use when the component is not controlled.
propDescriptions.disableIcon: If true, the checked icon is removed and the selected variant is applied on the action element instead.
propDescriptions.indeterminate: If true, the component appears indeterminate. This does not set the native input element to indeterminate due to inconsistent behavior across browsers. However, we set a data-indeterminate attribute on the input.
propDescriptions.indeterminateIcon: The icon to display when the component is indeterminate.
propDescriptions.label: The label element next to the checkbox.
propDescriptions.name: The name attribute of the input.
propDescriptions.onChange:
Callback fired when the state is changed.

Signature:
function(event: React.ChangeEvent<HTMLInputElement>) => void
event: The event source of the callback. You can pull out the new value by accessing event.target.value (string). You can pull out the new checked state by accessing event.target.checked (boolean).
propDescriptions.overlay: If true, the root element's position is set to initial which allows the action area to fill the nearest positioned parent. This prop is useful for composing Checkbox with ListItem component.
propDescriptions.readOnly: If true, the component is read only.
propDescriptions.sx: The system prop that allows defining system overrides as well as additional CSS styles. See the `sx` page for more details.
propDescriptions.value: The value of the component. The DOM API casts this to a string. The browser uses "on" as the default value.
